channel.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

public class Beer {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		String[] bottles = {"one more bottle ", "no more bottles ", "bottles "};
		for (int i = 99; i >= 1; i--) {
			String b = (i == 0 ? bottles[1] : i == 1 ? bottles[0] : i+" "+bottles[2]);
			System.out.println(b+"of beer on the wall, "+b+"of beer");
			System.out.println("Take one down and pass it around, "+(i-1 == 0 ? bottles[1] : i-1 == 1 ? bottles[0] : (i-1)+" "+bottles[2])+"of beer on the wall.");
		}
		System.out.println("No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.");
		System.out.println("Go to the store and buy some more, 99 bottles of beer on the wall.");
	}
}

Read full topic
item.source: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

public class Bottles { public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException { for (byte bottles = 99; bottles >= 0; bottles--) { System.out.println(bottles == 0 ? "No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer." : bottles + " bottles of beer on the wall, " + bottles + " bottles of beer."); Thread.sleep(500); System.out.println(bottles == 0 ? "Go to the store, buy some more. 99 bottles of beer on the wall." : "Take one down, pass it around. " + bottles + " bottles of beer on the wall."); Thread.sleep(500); } } }

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[code=java]public class Bottles {
public static void main(String[] args) {
bottles(99);
}

static void bottles(int remaining) {
	String output = (remaining != 1 ? "" + remaining + " bottles" : "1 bottle");
	System.out.println("" + output + " of beer on the wall, " + output
			+ " of beer\nTake one down, pass it around, " + output + " of beer on the wall.");
	if (remaining > 0)
		bottles(--remaining);
}

}
[/code]
Recursion op

Edit:
Because I know someone will be mad at me because that isn’t actually recursion and it doesn’t have unique text for 0 bottles, hurr

[code=java]public class Bottles {
public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println(bottles(99));
}

static String finalOutput = "";

static String bottles(int remaining) {
	String output = (remaining > 1 ? "" + remaining + " bottles" : "1 bottle");
	finalOutput += "" + output + " of beer on the wall, " + output
			+ " of beer\n"+(remaining == 0 ? "Go to the store, buy some more, "+output+" of beer on the wall" : "Take one down, pass it around, " + output + " of beer on the wall.\n");
	if (remaining > 0)
		return bottles(--remaining);
	return finalOutput;
}

}
[/code]

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[code=python]#!/usr/bin/python
def desc(n): return ‘bottle’ if n == 1 else ‘bottles’

def drink(orig, n):
if n:
print ‘%d %s of beer on the wall, %d %s of beer.’ % (n, desc(n), n, desc(n))
print ‘Take one down and pass it around, %d %s of beer on the wall.’ % (n - 1, desc(n - 1))
drink(orig, n - 1)
else:
print ‘No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.’
print ‘Go to the store and buy some more, %d %s of beer on the wall.’ % (orig, desc(orig))

if name == ‘main’: drink(99, 99)[/code]

[code=lisp]#lang racket
(define (desc n) (if (= n 1) “bottle” “bottles”))

(define (drink orig n)
(cond ((> n 0)
(printf “~a ~a of beer on the wall, ~a ~a of beer.~n” n (desc n) n (desc n))
(printf “Take one down and pass it around, ~a ~a of beer on the wall.~n” (sub1 n) (desc (sub1 n)))
(drink orig (sub1 n)))
(else
(displayln “No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.”)
(printf “Go to the store and buy some more, ~a ~a of beer on the wall.~n” orig (desc orig)))))

(drink 99 99)[/code]

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[code=c]#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdint.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

#define b_to_s(amt, buf)
switch (amt) {
case 0: sprintf(buf, “no bottles”); break;
case 1: sprintf(buf, “one bottle”); break;
default: sprintf(buf, “%d bottles”, amt); break;
}

void bottles(uint8_t amount)
{
char buf[11];
b_to_s(amount, buf);
printf("%s of beer on the wall, %s of beer\n", buf, buf);
b_to_s(amount - 1, buf)
printf(“take one down and pass it around, %s of beer on the wall.\n\n”, buf);
if (amount > 1) {
bottles(amount - 1);
} else {
printf(“no more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.\n”);
printf(“go to the store and buy some more, %s of beer on the wall.\n”, buf);
}
}

int main(int argc, char* argv[])
{
bottles(99u);
return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}[/code]
i win for using recursion.

Read full topic

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Here’s another Java variation.public class Beer { public static void main(String[] args) { int i = 100; while (--i > 0) { System.out.println(i + " bottles of beer on the wall, " + i + " bottles of beer,\n" + "take one down, pass it around, " + (i - 1) + " bottles of beer on the wall!\n"); if (i == 1) { i = 99; System.out.println("No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.\n" + "Go to the store, and buy some more, " + i + " bottles of beer on the wall!"); break; } } } }edit: made it look nicer when you run it.

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:9, topic:529946”][quote author=AtomicInt_ link=topic=648700.msg4362039#msg4362039 date=1378942854]

[code=csharp]namespace Bottles
{
public class Bottles
{
static void Main(string[] args)
{
SingSong(99, “beer”);
}

    void SingSong(int amount, string drink)
    {
        int bottles = amount;
        while(bottles != -1)
        {
            Console.WriteLine(amount + " of beer on the wall, " + BottleName(bottles) + " of " + drink + ".");
            bottles--;
            Console.WriteLine("Take one down and pass it around, " + BottleName(bottles) + " of " + drink + " on the wall.");
        }

        Console.WriteLine("No more bottles of " + drink + " on the wall, " + BottleName(0) + " of " + drink + ".");
        Console.WriteLine("Go to the store and buy some more, " + BottleName(amount) + " of " + drink + " on the wall.");
    }

    string BottleName(int amount)
    {
        return (amount == 0) ? "no more bottles" : ((amount == 1) ? "one bottle" : (amount + " bottles"));
    }
}

}[/code]

Did you write that code AtomicInt_? Or did you just take it from here: http://www.99-bottles-of-beer.net/language-xtend-2812.html

Just out of interest

Not from that specific site, but it was not written by me.[/quote]

Ah okay, just cause I’ve never seen xtend before and never seen you use it so I was confused about whether this was you trying to learn a new language or whatever[/quote]

I am trying to learn it, yes. The code was from a video instruction, (This may sound weird) I like to learn how certain things work by rewriting them as I see them written in front of me, so I can get a grasp of how things work and what the code is actually doing line-by-line, yes I can see what it’s doing by reading it but rewriting it works more effectively, it’s like writing your spelling words ten times each.

I’m currently writing a simple RS emulator in the language.

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Done:

If you wanna sing along:

/**
 * Created with IntelliJ IDEA.
 * User: Arham 4
 * Date: 9/11/13
 * Time: 5:31 PM
 * Purpose: Make the bottles of beer song.
 */
public class BottlesOfBeer {

    /**
     * The main method.
     * @param args The command-line arguments.
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        startSong(99);
    }

    /**
     * Starts the '99 Bottles of Beer' song.
     * @param bottles The amount of beer on the wall and how many bottles of beer.
     */
    private static void startSong(int bottles) throws Exception {
        int originalAmount = 0;
        boolean first = true;
        originalAmount = bottles;
        while (bottles != 0) {
            if (!first) {
                Thread.sleep(3500);
            } else {
                first = false;
            }
            System.out.println(bottles + " bottles of beer on the wall,");
            Thread.sleep(3500);
            System.out.println(bottles + " bottles of beer.");
            Thread.sleep(3350);
            String word = (bottles - 1) > 0 ? Integer.toString(bottles) + " bottles" : "no more bottles";
            if (bottles - 1 == 1) {
                word = "1 bottle";
            }
            System.out.println("Take one down and pass it around,");
            Thread.sleep(3500);
            System.out.println(word + " of beer on the wall.");
            System.out.println();
            bottles--;
        }
        System.out.println("No more bottles of beer on the wall,");
        Thread.sleep(3500);
        System.out.println("no more bottles of beer.");
        Thread.sleep(3350);
        System.out.println("Go to the store and buy some more,");
        Thread.sleep(3500);
        System.out.println(originalAmount + " bottles of beer on the wall.");
    }
}

If you just want it:

/**
 * Created with IntelliJ IDEA.
 * User: Arham 4
 * Date: 9/11/13
 * Time: 5:31 PM
 * Purpose: Make the bottles of beer song.
 */
public class BottlesOfBeer {

    /**
     * The main method.
     * @param args The command-line arguments.
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {
        startSong(99);
    }

    /**
     * Starts the '99 Bottles of Beer' song.
     * @param bottles The amount of beer on the wall and how many bottles of beer.
     */
    private static void startSong(int bottles) throws Exception {
        int originalAmount = 0;
        originalAmount = bottles;
        while (bottles != 0) {
            System.out.println(bottles + " bottles of beer on the wall, " + bottles + " bottles of beer.");
            String word = (bottles - 1) > 0 ? Integer.toString(bottles) + " bottles" : "no more bottles";
            if (bottles - 1 == 1) {
                word = "1 bottle";
            }
            System.out.println("Take one down and pass it around," + word + " of beer on the wall.");
            System.out.println();
            bottles--;
        }
        System.out.println("No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.");
        System.out.println("Go to the store and buy some more, " + originalAmount + " bottles of beer on the wall.");
    }
}

item.title: 99 Bottles of Beer on the Wall
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

package oremtius.beer

class BottlesOfBeer {

	def static void main(String[] args) {
		println(start(99));
	}

	def static start(int amount) '''
		«FOR i : amount .. 1»
			«i.bottles» of beer on the wall, «amount.bottles» of beer.
			Take one down and pass it around, «(i - 1).bottles» of beer on the wall.
		«ENDFOR»
		
		No more bottles of beer on the wall, no more bottles of beer.
		Go to the store and buy some more, «amount.bottles» of beer on the wall.
	'''

	def static bottles(int amount) {
		switch amount {
			case 0:
				'no more bottles'
			case 1:
				'one bottle'
			default: '''
				«amount» bottles
			'''
		}.toString.toFirstUpper
	}

}

Post yours!

Read full topic
